intro: Phacelia filiformis, commonly known as slender phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is valued in gardens for its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
